alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 10:12AM MDT until May 12 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Douglas and Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1010 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen in the last three hours on already rain soaked ground. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Aurora, Highlands Ranch, Castle Rock, Parker, southwestern Littleton, Lone Tree, Roxborough Park, Larkspur, Sedalia, Castle Pines, Perry Park, Louviers, Franktown, Greenland, The Pinery, Chatfield Reservoir, South Platte, Shamballa, Castlewood Canyon and Kassler.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
